@peacenicsta yep, I asked! 14 young dudes and the priest guy live upstairs
@peacenicsta so many potential issues: eg. what if they get sick? Can't volunteer, then lose food and shelter, can't work.
@_DanSc money goes to Catholic Jesuit programs. King St bars are profitable. Possible to pay a living legal wage and still donate profits.
@_DanSc I'm not opposed to volunteering either, but not keen to undercut wages of my mates who work in pubs up and down King St
@_DanSc Yep, I asked a couple of the staff/volunteers. They call it a "social enterprise" to make it sound better than it is.
Hoping next #FWDORG16 bar staff are paid legal wages & not be unpaid volunteers who live upstairs w a Catholic priest to fund church program
